meanings.definition: The quality or state of being modular.
meanings.sent1: The modularities of the building design allowed for easy expansion.
meanings.sent2: The modularities of the furniture made it simple to assemble.
meanings.sent3: The professor joked that the modularities of the puzzle pieces made them look like building blocks.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a collection of modularities, each idea neatly fitting into its own compartment.
meanings.sent5: The modularities of the Lego set made it a favorite among children.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a system or structure is composed of separate components that can be easily connected or rearranged.
meanings.sent1: The modularities of the computer system allowed for quick upgrades.
meanings.sent2: The modularities of the train tracks made maintenance more efficient.
meanings.sent3: The chef compared the modularities of the recipe to building blocks for a meal.
meanings.sent4: The team's success was attributed to the modularities of their strategy, adapting easily to changes.
meanings.sent5: The modularities of the mobile phone design made it user-friendly.
